intro: Dimerocostus cryptocalyx, commonly known as the sacred lotus of the Andes, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests and cloud forests. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often covered in a fine, waxy coating. The plant is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional Andean medicine for centuries.
